fields.headline: What's hot
fields.bodyText: Anguilla in style A private villa compound on a bluff overlooking Long Bay Beach is setting new standards for Anguilla. The master bedrooms in each of the three villas at Tenemos (Greek for sanctuary) have a huge marble bathroom with double bath and an outdoor shower; each villa has a stone deck with an infinity pool, an outdoor dining pavilion and access to a private beach. Resident staff will prepare meals in the villas or on the beach. Where to book: One week at a Tenemos villa costs from £3,803pp (based on 10 sharing) including flights with ITC Classics (01244 355527, itcclassics.co.uk). Corsican retreats Three converted shepherd's bergeries in the hills of southern Corsica will offer the ultimate island hideaway next summer. They are reached along an unmade track crossing a stream - a four-wheel drive vehicle is provided with the rental - but are just 15 minutes' drive from the port of Propriano. They date back to the 13th century but modern comforts include a plunge pool. Where to book: One week in a two-bedroom bergerie costs from £388pp including flights and car hire with Corsican Places (01903 748180, corsica.co.uk). Martinez gets a facelift One of the great symbols of the golden age of the French Riviera, the Hotel Martinez, which is situated on Cannes' famous La Croisette, is getting a facelift. Both the public areas and the Palme d'Or restaurant will be given a contemporary look, and will reopen in January. In addition, 12 new junior suites designed by JM Franck and a Givenchy spa will open in May. Where to book: Hotel Martinez (00 33 492 98 74 10, hotel-martinez.com).
